books.title: The Tempest
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A magic-induced tempest shipwrecks the king of Naples and his crew on an island inhabited by the usurped duke of Milan.

books.title: Ashenden
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short stories based on the experiences of an intelligence agent during World War I.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Phoenix and the Carpet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children once again encounter an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures around the world with its magic carpet.

books.title: David Harum
books.author: Edward Noyes Westcott
books.summary: An aimless young man leaves the city for a small village to work for a horse-trading country banker.

books.title: Hamlet
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: The ghost of the King of Denmark tells his son, Hamlet, to avenge his death.

books.title: The Crock of Gold
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: A philosopher sets out to rescue the beautiful Caitilin Ni Murrachu from the god Pan in an adventure that involves leprechauns, Celtic gods, policemen, and philosophical disquisitions both profound and absurd.

books.title: He Knew He Was Right
books.author: Anthony Trollope
books.summary: An older lothario interferes in the lives of a young married couple, driving them apart as each maintains their own innocence.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: The Education of Henry Adams
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A prominent and caustic historian reflects on the reasons that “the more he was educated, the less he understood,” and what he believes the future holds for American society.

books.title: The Man in the Queue
books.author: Josephine Tey
books.summary: A police inspector is baffled by the case of a man who was stabbed while waiting in a theater queue.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Genealogy of Morals
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.summary: Three essays analyzing the origins, meaning, and value of the concepts of good, evil, and bad; of guilt, punishment, and bad conscience; and of ascetic ideals, including those of truth and truthfulness.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: The History of Rasselas, Prince of Abyssinia
books.author: Samuel Johnson
books.summary: An Abyssinian prince embarks on adventures while exploring the meaning of happiness.

books.title: Looking Backward
books.author: Edward Bellamy
books.summary: A man falls asleep in 1887 and wakes up over a century later in a socialist utopia.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: Jack Keefe Stories
books.author: Ring Lardner
books.summary: A boastful, nearly illiterate major league pitcher writes a series of letters home detailing the goings-on in his life and career.
